content:
You're a diligent vehicle owner, keeping track of fuel efficiency and maintenance records. That's excellent! Reviewing those records will definitely help you identify any potential issues before your trip.

It's great to hear that you've recently taken care of some essential maintenance tasks, such as:

* Getting an oil change for your minivan
* Rotating the tires on your 4Runner
* Replacing the air filter on the 4Runner

These tasks will help ensure your vehicles are running smoothly and efficiently. The new air filter on your 4Runner should help improve fuel efficiency, and rotating the tires will help with even wear and traction.

Before your trip, consider double-checking the following:

* Brake pads: Make sure they have sufficient thickness and aren't excessively worn.
* Belts and hoses: Inspect them for signs of wear, cracks, or damage.
* Lights and signals: Ensure all lights, including headlights, taillights, and brake lights, are functioning properly.
* Wiper blades: Replace them if they're old or showing signs of wear.
* Spare tire: Check the air pressure and make sure it's in good condition.

By reviewing your records and performing these checks, you'll be well-prepared for your Oregon road trip. Don't forget to pack a roadside emergency kit, including items like jumper cables, a flashlight, and a first aid kit, just in case.

Safe travels, and enjoy your time exploring Oregon's scenic routes!
